action.action-desc: Mr. Blumenauer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To allow for hemp-derived cannabidiol and hemp-derived cannabidiol containing substances in dietary supplements and food.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Hemp Access and Consumer Safety Act.

section.header: Regulation of hemp-derived cannabidiol and hemp-derived cannabidiol containing substances

subsection.header: Inclusion in definition of dietary supplement
subsection.text: Section 201(ff)(3)(B) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 321(ff)(3)(B)) is amended in each of clauses (i) and (ii) by inserting (other than hemp, hemp-derived cannabidiol, or a substance containing any other ingredient derived from hemp) after an article.
Section 201 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 321) is amended by adding at the end the following:
The term hemp has the meaning given such term in section 297A(1) of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946.

Section 301(ll) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 331(ll)) is amended, in the matter preceding subparagraph (1), by inserting (other than hemp, hemp-derived cannabidiol, or a substance containing any other ingredient derived from hemp) after made public.
Consistent with the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 301 et seq.), the Secretary of Health and Human Services mayâ€”

paragraph.text: establish labeling and packaging requirements for dietary supplements and food that contain hemp, hemp-derived cannabidiol, or a substance containing any other ingredient derived from hemp; and

take additional enforcement actions with respect to products labeled as dietary supplements but not meeting the definition of such term in section 201(ff)(3)(B) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 321(ff)(3)(B)), as amended by subsection (a).
